Le projet consiste à incorporer les aires protégées aux processus de décentralisation du Burkina Faso en opérationnalisant des aires protégées sous gestion communautaire, y compris des forêts classées et leurs zones tampons.

title.narrative: FRENCH_Project_Maps_4298 Burkina Faso PA Buffer Zone Mgt_REV_
FRENCH_Documentation AdditionnelPIMS 4298 PRODOC_Burkina Faso PA Buffer Zone Mgt_corrigee

description.narrative: Le projet vise à intégrer la gestion des aires protégées dans le processus de décentralisation, sous gestion communautaire.
second-order administrative division
Energy - policy, planning and administration

To incorporate protected areas as a key tool for biodiversity conservation into Burkina Fasoâ€™s decentralization process through the operationalization of community managed protected areas, including gazetted forests and their buffer zones.

PAs and buffer zones (number of and hectarage) in the municipalities of Boromo, Tcheriba and Gassan in the Boucles du Mouhoun Region that are effectively co-managed by communities as conservation / sustainable use zones (implying a change in the PA management model)

comment.narrative: 0 protected areas and gazetted forests in the Mouhoun region allow effective community participation in conservation management

At least 1 national park and 4 gazetted forests and their buffer zones, covering approximately 160,000 hectares, are being co-managed by communities (e.g. through PA stewardship models) recognized by the State

No significant progress because of the change of the project manager and the lack of responsible person for the monitoring and evaluation; despite this situation, studies on "Elaboration de textes réglementaires locaux sur la co-gestion des ressources naturelles", "Conception des systèmes et outils de planification, ainsi que de suivi-évaluation prévoyant des objectifs de gestion des aires protégées compatibles avec le développement local durable" are on going and are expected be finalized in 2015.

description.narrative: Number of forest management and conservation committees established at the municipal/village level in the Boucles du Mouhoun PA Corridor (e.g. comitÃ©s villageoises des forÃªts-CVF, but also other types of community based groups that may be established with the help of the project)

comment.narrative: Community-based forest management committees are rare, ineffective and operate only in the buffer zones and outside the PAs
More than 20 community-based forest management committees are established and functioning in the buffer zones and within protected areas

No significant progress because of the change of the project manager and the lack of responsible person for monitoring and evaluation; despite this situation, two community-based forest management committees are create in the same area by PIF project and concertations between the two projects are ongoing for the use the same communities.

description.narrative: Status of the elephant population in the Mouhoun region (ecological corridor)

comment.narrative: Around 30 elephants (Deux BalÃ©s NP) and migrant herds along the Mouhoun corridor estimated roughly as 300-600 individuals
50+ elephants in Deux BalÃ©s and the maintenance of numbers for migrant herds along the Mouhoun corridor

No significant progress, but the study on "cartograhie thématique de la zone d'intervention du projet" is achieved and the TOR are prepared by the project for flora and fauna inventories in the region

description.narrative: Governance framework for the incorporation of conservation into Burkina Fasoâ€™s decentralization process established

The existence of adequate normative texts related to regulating and implementing participatory arrangements for forest resources and protected area management â€˜adequacyâ€™ to be independently assessed through project evaluations

comment.narrative: The Decentralization Law of 2004 contains provisions for â€œdevolutionâ€? of natural resource management to municipalities; there are, however, no official provisions to operationalize â€œdevolutionâ€? in practice.

A model for land stewardship agreement for gazetted forests and/or areas in their buffer zones involving communities has been developed and approved by DGFF and it is under initial implementation in the Boucles du Mouhoun Region on a pilot basis
No significant progress but the results of the ongoing study on "Elaboration de textes règlementaires locaux sur la co-gestion des ressources naturelles" will contribute to reach this objective

description.narrative: Financial and technical cooperation agreements to strengthen and promote local capacities in biodiversity management facilitated by the project

comment.narrative: None or very limited resources are available to municipalities and local groups to strengthen biodiversity management capacities

All 3 municipalities (Boromo, Tcheriba and Gassan) and at least 10 local groups participating in the project will have improved financial, technical and human resources capacities as a result of the project
No significant progress because of the national political context and the change of all the responsible peoples in the municipalities, and also due to the level of progress of the project activities

description.narrative: Increased scores on the UNDPâ€™s Capacity Development Scorecard for Protected Areas Management over the baseline Refer to Annex 5 for summarized and detailed scores.

comment.narrative:
Systemic 9 / 30 (30%)
Institutional 18 / 45 (40%)
Individual 10 / 21 (48%)
Overall 37/96
(General avg. 39%)
Scores, expressed in absolute terms, increase by at least 20%

No significant progress because of the change of project manager and the lack of responsible person for monitoring and evaluation; we think that the flora and fauna previous inventories will contributes to reach the objective

description.narrative: The effective management of community PAs is demonstrated in pilot sites in the Boucles du Mouhoun PA Corridor

Increased scores on the GEF4â€™s PA Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool â€œMETTâ€? for all five pilot PAs (1 National Park or â€œNPâ€?; and 4 Gazetted Forests or â€œFCâ€?) in the Boucles du Mouhoun Refer to Annex 6 for the complete SO1 Tracking Tool.

comment.narrative:
[1] Deux BalÃ©s NP 51
[2] Tisse FC 30
[3] Oualou FC 30
[4] SÃ¢ FC 30
[5] Sourou FC 30
All scores 40 by the MTE All scores are 50 by end of project

No significant progress because of the change of project manager and the lack of responsible person for monitoring and evaluation; we think that the flora and fauna previous inventories will contributes to reach the objective

description.narrative: PA management and business plans prepared for pilot sites in the Boucles du Mouhoun

comment.narrative: None of the target sites for the project count on a management plan None of the sites count on a PA business plans
All PA pilot sites count on up-to-date management and business plans under initial implementation

No significant progress because of the change of project manager and the lack of responsible person for monitoring and evaluation; we think that the flora and fauna previous inventories and the studies on "Conception de systèmes et outils de planification, ainsi que le suivi-évaluation prévoyant des objectifs de gestion des aires protégées compatibles avec le développement local durable" and "Elaboration des textes règlementaires locaux sur la co-gestion des ressources naturelles" will contributes to reach the objective

description.narrative: Communities perception of their livelihood stake in the good stewardship of biological resources in pilot sites in the Boucles du Mouhoun PA Corridor, measured through the periodic and independent application of the â€˜Most Significant Changeâ€™ (MSC) technique

comment.narrative: Not Applicable The MSC technique is to be applied once the project has been launched and some form of change has occurred. The baseline corresponds to all assessments that corroborate the situation analysis for this project, particularly with respect to land-uses and livelihoods.
Positive changes in livelihoods are perceived through the independent application of the MSC technique

No significant progress because of the change of project manager and the lack of responsible person for monitoring and evaluation; despite the situation, the ongoing studies on "Conservation ou réintroduction d'espèces végétales disparues, rares ou menacées des zones tampins de la région de la Boucle du Mouhoun" and "Cartographie thématiques de la zones d'intervention du projet" will contributes to reach the objective
